entry.title: Ukraine Races to Restore Power, Water in Kherson After Russian Withdrawal
entry.content: Ukrainian forces that swept into the southern city over the weekend were greeted by jubilant crowds, but a municipal official said the humanitarian situation in the city was critical.

entry.title: China's Global Port Investments Give Rise to Security Worries
entry.content: The expanding network could make it easier for Beijing to service a Chinese navy that has become one of Washington’s biggest military concerns, analysts say.

entry.title: Inside the Kyiv Power Cuts: Cold Food, Scheduled Vacuuming, Struggling Businesses
entry.content: Russia has targeted Ukraine’s electricity grid in an attempt to break civilians’ will, resulting in rolling power cuts in Kyiv. Residents are adapting.

entry.title: As Russian Army Falters in Ukraine, Paramilitary Leader Close to Putin Flexes Power
entry.content: Yevgeny Prigozhin, founder of the Wagner Group, is using his force’s battlefield presence to gain sway with the Kremlin and shape military decisions.

entry.title: U.K. Economy Slides Toward Recession
entry.content: High energy costs, rising interest rates and a labor shortage weighed on British output in the three months through September.
